If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!

**Version Number:** 9.3.11-17
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** No
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/75984
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** snoijoijsiojsiojsioj@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome
**App Component:** Money Requests

## Action Performed:
Precondition:
- Workspace has per diem rates.

1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com
2. Go to workspace chat.
3. Create a per diem expense.
4. Go to workspace settings > Per diem.
5. Select all the rates and delete them all.
6. Go back to workspace chat.
7. Open the per diem expense.
8. Click More > Split > Save.

## Expected Result:
Per diem expense should be split without issue (production).

## Actual Result:
"Please fix the distance rate error" shows up when no distance rate is involved.

## Workaround:
Unknown

title: Report History in New Expensify Does Not Reflect Retried Reimbursement

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3.10-6
**Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction
**Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @abbagail
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1769796213458829)

## Action Performed:

1. Have a reimbursement fail due to a bank account issue
2. User later adds or fixes their bank account
3. System automatically retries the reimbursement
4. Open the report in New Expensify
5. View Report History

## Expected Result:
Report History in New Expensify should show that:
The bank account was added or updated
The reimbursement was re-initiated
The report is now paid or in progress
History should match what is shown in Expensify Classic.
## Actual Result:
New Expensify only shows the original failure message
No indication that reimbursement was retried
Admins cannot tell whether payment is already in progress
Classic correctly reflects the updated reimbursement activity.
## Workaround:
Unknown

## Platforms:
Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome
- [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

## Screenshots/Videos

The screenshots for the issue are in slack [thread](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1769796213458829)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3.11-15
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/442169
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Regression TC Execution
**Device used:** Apple iPhone 13 - iOS 26.2
**App Component:** Other

## Action Performed:
Pre-requisite: user must have set the language preference to Spanish

1. Go to any chat you can submit an expense (DM or WS)
2. Submit a Scan request, take or upload any photo
3. Before the image is scanned, tap on the expense preview and set an amount

## Expected Result:
The system message is: "estableció el importe a XXX"

## Actual Result:
The system message is: "cambió el importe a XXX (previamente XXX)", but the expense was in the scanning process and amount was not set.
( The same in English, the system message is "changed the amount to XXX (previously XXX)" while scanning a receipt)

## Workaround:
Unknown

**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Regression TC Execution
**Device used:** Windows 11/Chrome, iPhone 16/iOS 18.7.1, Pixel 8a/Android 16
**App Component:** User Settings

## Action Performed:
1. Navigate to staging.new.expensify.com
2. Navigate to account settings > Profile
3. Click on "Contact Method"
4. Enter the magic code sent to main contact
5. Add a email as secondary contact method
6. Disable the internet connection
7. Verify the "Verify" button is disabled
8.  Paste the magic code
9. Go online in troubleshoot modal (CTRL+D)
10. Wait for the troubleshoot modal to dismiss automatically (In my case, once I turned OFF Force offline toggle, modal dismissed automatcally)

## Expected Result:
User should be redirected to contact methods after going online list on verifying secondary login

## Actual Result:
After going online, user not redirected to contact method list on verifying secondary login. User

Unknown

## Action Performed:
1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com
2. Go to workspace chat.
3. Create two expenses in two different reports.
4. Go to Reports > Expenses.
5. Select an expense via checkbox.
6. Click More > Merge.
7. Select the other expense > Continue.
8. Select the details from the other expense (the second option) > Next.
9. Click Merge expenses.
10. Click More > Delete.
11. Delete the expense.

## Expected Result:
Report RHP will close.

## Actual Result:
Not here page opens after merging expenses and deleting it.

Unknown

title: QuickBooks Desktop credit card associations do not persist in New Expensify and display an incorrect hyphenated ID instead of the QBD card name

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:**
**Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Unable to reproduce)
**Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @MarianaaaxG
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1769715450746449)

## Action Performed:

1. Navigate to New Expensify → Company Cards.
2. Observe that cards display a long hyphenated ID instead of the QBD credit card name.
3. Click into the card mapping in New Expensify and note that no QBD card is selected, despite Classic showing correct associations.

## Expected Result:
Company cards in New Expensify should display the correct QuickBooks Desktop credit card name.
Card-to-QBD account associations should persist consistently between Classic and New Expensify.
## Actual Result:
New Expensify shows a long hyphenated ID instead of the QBD card name.
No QBD card appears selected in New Expensify, even though Classic shows correct mappings.
Card associations revert or appear unassigned in New Expensify, requiring manual reassignment in Classic.
## Workaround:
Unknown

- [ ] iOS: App

- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome

- [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

**Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction

**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @jliexpensify 
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1769637743507189)

## Action Performed:

1. Have someone send a chat to you
2. Wait for the notification email to come through
3. Navigate back to your Inbox and see no updates
4. Refresh page and see new chat/s
(inconsistently happening - Maybe if leave New Expensify logged in over a long period (e.g. overnight ), then nothing refreshes. But once refresh, everything seems to update)
## Expected Result:
Inbox should immediately populate new chats when they come in (i.e. no need to refresh)
## Actual Result:
Inbox isn’t updating/populating with new chats (unless you refresh)
## Workaround:
Unknown

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3.11.15
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-3934/folder/13176676/75383154/1159242921?sort=%2Bidentifier
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** n/a
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Regression TC Execution
**Device used:** iPhone 13 iOS 26.2
**App Component:** Workspace Settings

## Action Performed:
Preconditions: User is an admin of the workspace with Tags enabled

1. Open the app
2. Navigate to workspace settings > Tags
3. Click "More" > "Import spreadsheet"
4. Click "Multi-level tags" > "Import tags"
5. Upgrade the workspace if a paywall is displayed (to a Control plan)
6. Upload a dependent multi-level tags CSV file
7.  "These are independent tags" is DISABLED
8. Click "Import" and then "Got it" on the success modal

## Expected Result:
The informational text is readable and fully visible without having to scroll up under the “More” dropdown

## Actual Result:
The informational text is overlapping itself and not fully visible under the “More” dropdown.

## Workaround:
Unknown

- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [x] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
